data.name: TemplateRoute_CannotHaveCatchAllInMultiSegment
data.value: A path segment that contains more than one section, such as a literal section or a parameter, cannot contain a catch-all parameter.

data.name: TemplateRoute_CannotHaveDefaultValueSpecifiedInlineAndExplicitly
data.value: The route parameter '{0}' has both an inline default value and an explicit default value specified. A route parameter cannot contain an inline default value when a default value is specified explicitly. Consider removing one of them.

data.name: TemplateRoute_CannotHaveConsecutiveParameters
data.value: A path segment cannot contain two consecutive parameters. They must be separated by a '/' or by a literal string.

data.name: TemplateRoute_CannotHaveConsecutiveSeparators
data.value: The route template separator character '/' cannot appear consecutively. It must be separated by either a parameter or a literal value.

data.name: TemplateRoute_CatchAllCannotBeOptional
data.value: A catch-all parameter cannot be marked optional.

data.name: TemplateRoute_OptionalCannotHaveDefaultValue
data.value: An optional parameter cannot have default value.

data.name: TemplateRoute_CatchAllMustBeLast
data.value: A catch-all parameter can only appear as the last segment of the route template.

data.name: TemplateRoute_InvalidLiteral
data.value: The literal section '{0}' is invalid. Literal sections cannot contain the '?' character.

data.name: TemplateRoute_InvalidParameterName
data.value: The route parameter name '{0}' is invalid. Route parameter names must be non-empty and cannot contain these characters: '{{', '}}', '/'. The '?' character marks a parameter as optional, and can occur only at the end of the parameter. The '*' character marks a parameter as catch-all, and can occur only at the start of the parameter.

data.name: TemplateRoute_InvalidRouteTemplate
data.value: The route template cannot start with a '~' character unless followed by a '/'.

data.name: TemplateRoute_MismatchedParameter
data.value: There is an incomplete parameter in the route template. Check that each '{' character has a matching '}' character.

data.name: TemplateRoute_RepeatedParameter
data.value: The route parameter name '{0}' appears more than one time in the route template.

data.name: TemplateRoute_UnescapedBrace
data.value: In a route parameter, '{' and '}' must be escaped with '{{' and '}}'.

data.name: TemplateRoute_OptionalParameterCanbBePrecededByPeriod
data.value: In the segment '{0}', the optional parameter '{1}' is preceded by an invalid segment '{2}'. Only a period (.) can precede an optional parameter.

data.name: TemplateRoute_OptionalParameterHasTobeTheLast
data.value: An optional parameter must be at the end of the segment. In the segment '{0}', optional parameter '{1}' is followed by '{2}'.

data.name: TemplateRoute_Exception
data.value: An error occurred while creating the route with name '{0}' and template '{1}'.

data.name: AttributeRoute_TokenReplacement_EmptyTokenNotAllowed
data.value: An empty replacement token ('[]') is not allowed.

data.name: AttributeRoute_TokenReplacement_ImbalancedSquareBrackets
data.value: Token delimiters ('[', ']') are imbalanced.

data.name: AttributeRoute_TokenReplacement_UnclosedToken
data.value: A replacement token is not closed.

data.name: AttributeRoute_TokenReplacement_UnescapedBraceInToken
data.value: An unescaped '[' token is not allowed inside of a replacement token. Use '[[' to escape.

data.name: Analyzer_HeaderDictionaryIndexer_Message
data.value: The header '{0}' can be accessed using the {1} property

data.name: Analyzer_HeaderDictionaryIndexer_Title
data.value: Suggest using IHeaderDictionary properties

data.name: Analyzer_RequestDelegateReturnValue_Message
data.value: The method used to create a RequestDelegate returns Task<{0}>. RequestDelegate discards this value. If this isn't intended then change the return type to non-generic Task or, if the delegate is a route handler, cast it to Delegate so the return value is written to the response.

data.name: Analyzer_RequestDelegateReturnValue_Title
data.value: Do not return a value from RequestDelegate

data.name: Analyzer_RouteIssue_Message
data.value: Route issue: {0}

data.name: Analyzer_RouteIssue_Title
data.value: Invalid route pattern

data.name: Analyzer_UnusedParameter_Message
data.value: Unused route parameter '{0}'

data.name: Analyzer_UnusedParameter_Title
data.value: Unused route parameter

data.name: Analyzer_HeaderDictionaryAdd_Message
data.value: Use IHeaderDictionary.Append or the indexer to append or set headers. IDictionary.Add will throw an ArgumentException when attempting to add a duplicate key.

data.name: Analyzer_HeaderDictionaryAdd_Title
data.value: Suggest using IHeaderDictionary.Append or the indexer

data.name: Analyzer_MultipleFromBody_Message
data.value: Route handler has multiple parameters with the [FromBody] attribute or a parameter with an [AsParameters] attribute where the parameter type contains multiple members with [FromBody] attributes. Only one parameter can have a [FromBody] attribute.

data.name: Analyzer_MultipleFromBody_Title
data.value: Route handler has multiple parameters with the [FromBody] attribute

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseModelBindingAttributesOnRouteHandlerParameters_Title
data.value: Do not use model binding attributes with route handlers

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseModelBindingAttributesOnRouteHandlerParameters_Message
data.value: {0} should not be specified for a {1} Delegate parameter

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotReturnActionResultsFromRouteHandlers_Title
data.value: Do not use action results with route handlers

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotReturnActionResultsFromRouteHandlers_Message
data.value: IActionResult instances should not be returned from a {0} Delegate parameter. Consider returning an equivalent result from Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.Results.

data.name: Analyzer_DetectMisplacedLambdaAttribute_Title
data.value: Do not place attribute on method called by route handler lambda

data.name: Analyzer_DetectMisplacedLambdaAttribute_Message
data.value: '{0}' should be placed directly on the route handler lambda to be effective

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseNonLiteralSequenceNumbers_Title
data.value: Do not use non-literal sequence numbers

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseNonLiteralSequenceNumbers_Message
data.value: '{0}' should not be used as a sequence number. Instead, use an integer literal representing source code order.

data.name: Analyzer_DetectMismatchedParameterOptionality_Title
data.value: Route parameter and argument optionality is mismatched

data.name: Analyzer_DetectMismatchedParameterOptionality_Message
data.value: '{0}' argument should be annotated as optional or nullable to match route parameter

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseConfigureWebHostWithConfigureHostBuilder_Title
data.value: Do not use ConfigureWebHost with WebApplicationBuilder.Host

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseConfigureWebHostWithConfigureHostBuilder_Message
data.value: ConfigureWebHost cannot be used with WebApplicationBuilder.Host

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseConfigureWithConfigureWebHostBuilder_Title
data.value: Do not use Configure with WebApplicationBuilder.WebHost

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseConfigureWithConfigureWebHostBuilder_Message
data.value: Configure cannot be used with WebApplicationBuilder.WebHost

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseUseStartupWithConfigureWebHostBuilder_Title
data.value: Do not use UseStartup with WebApplicationBuilder.WebHost

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseUseStartupWithConfigureWebHostBuilder_Message
data.value: UseStartup cannot be used with WebApplicationBuilder.WebHost

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseHostConfigureLogging_Title
data.value: Suggest using builder.Logging over Host.ConfigureLogging or WebHost.ConfigureLogging

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseHostConfigureLogging_Message
data.value: Suggest using builder.Logging instead of {0}

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseHostConfigureServices_Title
data.value: Suggest using builder.Services over Host.ConfigureServices or WebHost.ConfigureServices

data.name: Analyzer_DoNotUseHostConfigureServices_Message
data.value: Suggest using builder.Services instead of {0}

data.name: Analyzer_DisallowConfigureAppConfigureHostBuilder_Title
data.value: Suggest switching from using Configure methods to WebApplicationBuilder.Configuration

data.name: Analyzer_DisallowConfigureAppConfigureHostBuilder_Message
data.value: Suggest using WebApplicationBuilder.Configuration instead of {0}

data.name: Analyzer_UseTopLevelRouteRegistrationsInsteadOfUseEndpoints_Title
data.value: Suggest using top level route registrations

data.name: Analyzer_UseTopLevelRouteRegistrationsInsteadOfUseEndpoints_Message
data.value: Suggest using top level route registrations instead of {0}

data.name: Analyzer_RouteParameterComplexTypeIsNotParsable_Title
data.value: Complex types referenced by route parameters must be parsable

data.name: Analyzer_RouteParameterComplexTypeIsNotParsable_Message
data.value: Parameter '{0}' of type {1} should define a bool TryParse(string, IFormatProvider, out {1}) method, or implement IParsable<{1}>

data.name: Analyzer_BindAsyncSignatureMustReturnValueTaskOfT_Title
data.value: When implementing BindAsync(...) method, the return type must be ValueTask<T>

data.name: Analyzer_BindAsyncSignatureMustReturnValueTaskOfT_Message
data.value: Parameter '{0}' of type {1} has a BindAsync(...) method, but the return type is not ValueTask<{1}>. Consider implementing IBindableFromHttpContext<{1}> to enforce implementation.

data.name: Analyzer_AmbiguousRouteHandlerRoute_Title
data.value: Route conflict detected between route handlers

data.name: Analyzer_AmbiguousRouteHandlerRoute_Message
data.value: Route '{0}' conflicts with another handler route. An HTTP request that matches multiple routes results in an ambiguous match error. Fix the conflict by changing the route's pattern, HTTP method, or route constraints.

data.name: Analyzer_AmbiguousActionRoute_Title
data.value: Route conflict detected between controller actions

data.name: Analyzer_AmbiguousActionRoute_Message
data.value: Route '{0}' conflicts with another action route. An HTTP request that matches multiple routes results in an ambiguous match error. Fix the conflict by changing the route's pattern, HTTP method, or route constraints.

data.name: Analyzer_UseAddAuthorizationBuilder_Message
data.value: Use AddAuthorizationBuilder to register authorization services and construct policies

data.name: Analyzer_UseAddAuthorizationBuilder_Title
data.value: Use AddAuthorizationBuilder

data.name: Analyzer_OverriddenAuthorizeAttribute_Message
data.value: This [Authorize] attribute is overridden by an [AllowAnonymous] attribute from farther away on '{0}'. See https://aka.ms/aspnetcore-warnings/ASP0026 for more details.

data.name: Analyzer_OverriddenAuthorizeAttribute_Title
data.value: [Authorize] overridden by [AllowAnonymous] from farther away

data.name: Analyzer_PublicPartialProgramClass_Message
data.value: Using public partial class Program { } to make the generated Program class public is no longer required in ASP.NET Core apps. See https://aka.ms/aspnetcore-warnings/ASP0027 for more details.

data.name: Analyzer_PublicPartialProgramClass_Title
data.value: Unnecessary public Program class declaration

data.name: Analyzer_KestrelShouldListenOnIPv6AnyInsteadOfIpAny_Title
data.value: Consider using ListenAnyIP() instead of Listen(IPAddress.Any)

data.name: Analyzer_KestrelShouldListenOnIPv6AnyInsteadOfIpAny_Message
data.value: If the server does not specifically reject IPv6, IPAddress.IPv6Any is preferred over IPAddress.Any usage for safety and performance reasons. See https://aka.ms/aspnetcore-warnings/ASP0028 for more details.
